alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Niagara; Northern Erie; Orleans (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 2:10PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WITH VERY HEAVY SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF ORLEANS...GENESEE... NIAGARA...AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A lake effect snow band accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH will rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. These snowfall rates will increase to 2 to 3 inches per hour by 4 PM EST. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 200 PM EST, a lake effect snow band was located from Grand Island to Amherst to Medina, drifting southeast into the Northtowns. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Medina, Albion, Williamsville, Grand Island, Newfane, Pendleton, and Pembroke. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48A and 54. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. The snow will accumulate so rapidly that it will be extremely difficult for the road crews to keep the roads clear. &&
